info.name: Loyalty Contact API
info.description:
This API is used to manage everything related to contacts in your loyalty program.

Contact Support:
 Name: Amit Smoller
 Email: amit@loyalsys.io

header.description: (Required) This is the contact's externalId which you also use in your sales data upload to Smart Insights (Management -> Smart Insight Settings -> Contact Fields -> Unique identifier). More info here.

The ISO identifier of the language in which to return the results (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes). Please note that the format of the language header depends on the language selected in the user interface. For example, if you selected "English" the proper code is `en`. However, if in the user interface you specified a particular locale, for example "English (United States)", the correct format is `en-US`. Some other examples: "Spanish": `es` vs. "Spanish (Spain)": `es-ES` and "Chinese": `zh` vs. "Chinese (People's Republic of China)": `zh-CN`.'
The ISO identifier of the currency in which to return the results. (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217)

header.description: (Required) This is the contact's externalId which you also use in your sales data upload to Smart Insights (Management -> Smart Insight Settings -> Contact Fields -> Unique identifier). More info here.
DEPRECATED: (please use x-market instead)
A string representing the target market for which to return the results.

The ISO identifier of the language in which to return the results (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes). Please note that the format of the language header depends on the language selected in the user interface. For example, if you selected "English" the proper code is `en`. However, if in the user interface you specified a particular locale, for example "English (United States)", the correct format is `en-US`. Some other examples: "Spanish": `es` vs. "Spanish (Spain)": `es-ES` and "Chinese": `zh` vs. "Chinese (People's Republic of China)": `zh-CN`.'
The ISO identifier of the currency in which to return the results. (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217)

item.name: Downgrade the tier which a contact is in.

header.description: (Required) This is the contact's externalId which you also use in your sales data upload to Smart Insights (Management -> Smart Insight Settings -> Contact Fields -> Unique identifier). More info here.
A short reason why the contact tier was changed
The ID of the tier

What to do with the contact after removal from invitation-only tier. If you are downgrading from a regular tier this is not relevant.
The value can be one of the following strings:
auto - the contact will be placed in the tier matching his current status points (tierId is then not required)
manual - the contact will be placed in the tier specified by the tierId passed in this API request (tierId is then required)

request.description:
Downgrade the tier which a contact is in. This can be any tier which is below the tier which the contact is currently in.
Note: After changing tiers, the contact will automatically get the minimum required status points for the tier.

response.name: Tier downgraded successfully
